result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman

records.addlTxt: 1:57 PM Called 22CF44 and 22CF62 for STC and 22CF196 and 22CF210 for WOPH. Defendant Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman appeared by phone.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions def, Attny Gramstrup and State satisfied it is def on the phone.  Due to recent filings court sees today is set for WOPH, Attny Gramstrup confirms WOPH.  22CF196 and 22CF210 on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over in each case.  State files information's for both cases, they mirror criminal complaints. Both cases on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of both information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of all charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts on both cases.  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Request to Appear Remote

Bond to cover Burnett County cases 22CF44, 22CF62, 22CF196, and 22CF210.  Defendant cannot leave the State of Wisconsin without court approval.  Defendant must be supervised by her son, R.B. Jr. and must reside with him.  Defendant is subject to a curfew, she must be in her house by 6 pm and cannot leave it until 6 am, except for any emergency or medical issues.   No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.

10:14 AM Cases 22CF44, 22CF196, and 22CF62 called together.  Defendant Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def waives all in person appearance KIV.  State notes def has new case- 22CF210; will proceed to initial appearance today, State serves def complaint personally in court.  Cases 22CF196 and 22CF210 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaints, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def enters NG pleas to misdemeanors, per Atty Gramstrup, def willing to waive prelim on the felonies in 22CF196.  WTLPH.  State does not request new bond, but asks bond to cover all open cases.  Atty Gramstrup to be appointed on all files.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:07 AM Cases 22CF44 and 22F62 called together.  Defendant Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman not in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def does not appear- def was re-noticed to change the date and def received a citation recently with an appearance for 9/14.  Court to adjourn to that 9/14 date in the new file (22cf196) to track.  Court will appoint atty Gramstrup to the new file, will reassess the monthly payment.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman. Attny Grampstrup updates the court, close to resolution but possible new charges. Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:20 AM Cases 22CF44 and 22CF62 called together. Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: working on global resolution; requesting 1 more STC.  Bond continues.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.

03:11 PM Called 22CF44 for PH and 22CF62 for INIT. Defendant, Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman, appeared in person with Attorney Chris A Gramstrup by video.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State in person.  Attny Confirms 22CF44 will be a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing today.  Case 22CF62 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Court reviews court appointed attny fees, notified that def couldn't pay $500 deposit, Court orders to split the deposit into $100/month payments until paid.  Def agrees.  Court will keep Attny Gramstrup on today.
Attny Gramstrup confirms both cases on for WOPH today. 22CF44 & 22CF62 on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PHs; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to both PHs knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information in 22CF44, will work with office to file information in 22CF62 by tomorrow.  Both will mirror their criminal complaints.  Both cases on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to counts 1, 2 & 3 in 22CF44 and count 1 in 22CF62.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

02:52 PM Defendant, Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman, appeared with Attorney Chris A Gramstrup.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Atty Gramstrup makes a special appearance today- pending Court appointment petition.  Court reviews court-appointed process.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG to misdemeanor.  WTLPH.  Bond continues.  Discussion of bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant

1:08 PM Defendant, Katherine Lee-Boatman, appears in custody by video from Burnett County Jail.  District Attorney, James Jay Rennicke, appears on behalf of the State.  Case is on for bail hearing.  Court makes record RE: previous and existing bonds and def's condition.  Def has not yet applied for PD, intends to do so.  Def updates on condition.  Jail updates on def's condition and jail's ability to meet medical needs.  State asks for high signature bond w/ no leaving WI without prior court approval and curfew of 11 am-7 pm except for employment or medical needs.  Court amends bond to $5000 signature bond with various additional conditions.

Defendant cannot leave the State of Wisconsin without court approval.  Defendant must be supervised by her son, R.B. Jr. and must reside with him.  Defendant is subject to a curfew, she must be in her house by 6 pm and cannot leave it until 6 am, except for any emergency or medical issues.   No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.
